QuizletFinal:
*below*
adverb: below, down, downstairs.
Abajo hay una cafetería. Downstairs there is a cafeteria.

*dr*
.
"El Dr. García es un médico muy respetado." - "Dr. García is a very respected doctor."

*daughter*
noun: daughter
abbreviation: d..
Mi hija es mi luz en la vida. - My daughter is my light in life.

*leave*
verb: leave, let, stop.
Dejé el libro en la mesa. - I left the book on the table.

*needs*
verb: need, require, take.
"Él necesita un abrigo para el invierno."
He needs a coat for the winter.

*arrive*
verb: get, reach, arrive.
"Llegué tarde al trabajo." - I arrived late to work.

*do*
verb: do, make, ask.
Hago la tarea. = I do my homework.

*lady*
noun: lady, madam, mistress
abbreviation: Mrs., Ms..
La señora es muy amable. - The lady is very kind.

*is*
noun: beech, beech tree.
"Ojalá haya paz en el mundo." - "Hopefully there is peace in the world."

*enough*
adjective: enough, sufficient, adequate
adverb: enough, sufficiently, plenty of
noun: D.
"Tiene suficiente para comer." - He has enough to eat.

*doctor*
noun: doctor, doc.
"El doctor es muy inteligente." - The doctor is very intelligent.

*would like*
verb: like, taste, love.
"Me gustaría ir a la playa." - I would like to go to the beach.

*land*
noun: land, earth, ground.
"La tierra es nuestro hogar." - The earth is our home.

*expensive*
noun: face, side, look.
"Ella tiene una cara bonita" - She has a pretty face.

*even*
adverb: at least
conjunction: though.
"No siquiera sé cómo llegué aquí." - I don't even know how I got here.

*brilliant*
adjective: brilliant, genial, masterly.
"Este lugar es genial!" - "This place is great!"

*believe*
verb: create, make, set up.
Él cree que todo es posible. He believes that anything is possible.

*supposed*
adjective: supposed, pretended, so-called
noun: think, postulation.
"Supuesto que sí, voy a ir." Translation: "Supposedly yes, I'm going to go."

*take*
verb: take, have, drink.
Tomé un café con leche esta mañana. - I had a coffee with milk this morning.

*equipment*
noun: team, equipment, crew.
"El equipo ganó el partido." - The team won the game.

*fair*
adjective: just, right, righteous
adverb: just, bang.
"Justo ahora estoy aprendiendo español." - "I'm just learning Spanish now."

*game*
noun: game, play, set.
"A mi me gusta jugar al juego de cartas." - I like to play card games.

*none*
adjective: no, neither, whatever.
Ninguna persona estaba en la sala.
Nobody was in the room.

*kill*
verb: kill, slay, murder.
"Él mató a una araña con un zapato." - He killed a spider with a shoe.

*five*
noun: five
: five.
"Tengo cinco hermanos." - I have five siblings.

*they say*
verb: say, tell, speak.
"Dicen que el cielo es el límite." - They say the sky is the limit.

*love*
noun: owner, householder.
"Amo el helado." - I love ice cream.

*when*
interjection: When?.
Cuándo vas a la playa? - When are you going to the beach?

*little*
adjective: small, little, short
noun: child, dwarf, juniper.
"Él es un pequeño niño" - He is a little boy.

*some*
adjective: some, few
pronoun: some
adverb: a few.
Algunos estudiantes salieron temprano de la clase. - Some students left class early.

*know*
verb: know, meet, learn.
Conozco a muchas personas. - I know many people.

*class*
noun: class, kind, sort.
"Ella asistió a la clase de matemáticas." - She attended the math class.

*damned*
adjective: damn, fucking, cursed
noun: darn.
"¡Eres un maldito mentiroso!" - "You are a damned liar!"

*nails*
adjective: some.
Unas cuantas personas están aquí. - A few people are here.

*many*
adjective: many, numerous
noun: many
pronoun: many
adverb: much.
Muchos amigos se reúnen para celebrar el cumpleaños.
Many friends gather to celebrate the birthday.

*had*
verb: have.
"Hubiera podido venir, pero tenía otros planes." - I could have come, but I had other plans.

*second*
adjective: second, second-best
noun: second, second best
: second
abbreviation: sec
prefix: under-.
"El segundo lugar es para mí." - The second place is for me.

*although*
conjunction: although, though, even though.
Aunque llueva, salgo a caminar.  Although it rains, I go out for a walk.

*can*
verb: be able to, can, may.
"Pueda ayudarte con eso." - I can help you with that.

*tell me*
.
"Dime cuándo quieres salir." - Tell me when you want to leave.

*equal*
adjective: equal, same, like
noun: equal, peer, match.
"Es igual para mí." - It's the same for me.

*meal*
noun: food, meal, lunch.
La comida es deliciosa. - The food is delicious.

*Oh*
.
"Ay, qué lástima!" - Oh, what a shame!

*body*
noun: body, corps, length.
"Mi cuerpo está cansado después de un largo día." - My body is tired after a long day.

*find*
verb: find, meet, encounter.
Encontré una moneda en el suelo. - I found a coin on the ground.

*strong*
adjective: strong, sharp, hard
noun: fort, forte, metier
adverb: sharply, stoutly.
"Él es un niño muy fuerte." - He is a very strong boy.

*lap*
noun: turn, return, round.
"Tomé la vuelta para ir a casa." - I took the turn to go home.

*come on*
verb: come, come round, come through.
"Venga, vamos a comer!" - Come on, let's go eat!

*believe*
verb: believe, think, trust.
Creo que tengo la solución. - I believe I have the solution.

*reality*
noun: reality, fact, actuality.
"La realidad es que no hay nada más importante que la familia." - The reality is that there is nothing more important than family.

*they know*
verb: know, realize, taste.
"Ellos saben la verdad" - They know the truth.

*bitch*
noun: bitch, whore, slut.
"Eres una puta." = "You are a slut."

*you should*
verb: must, owe, job.
Deberías salir a caminar. - You should go for a walk.

*ask*
noun: question, inquiry, query.
La pregunta es ¿cuándo? - The question is when?

*I was*
verb: be, come, come of.
Fui al parque. - I went to the park.

*four*
noun: four
: four.
"Tengo cuatro gatos." - I have four cats.

*mrs*
abbreviation: Mrs., Ms..
La Sra. Gómez es una maestra muy amable.

Mrs. Gomez is a very kind teacher.

*first*
adjective: first, former.
"Mi primer regalo fue una bicicleta." - My first gift was a bicycle.

*work*
verb: work, job, labor.
Ella trabaja en una oficina. - She works in an office.

*and*
conjunction: and.
Ella es mi mejor amiga. - She is my best friend.

*you do*
verb: do, make, ask.
"Hagas lo que hagas, siempre tendrás mi apoyo." -No matter what you do, you will always have my support.

*high*
adjective: high, tall, upper
adverb: loud, aloud
noun: stop, halt, standstill.
"Él es alto y guapo." - He is tall and handsome.

*damned*
adjective: damn, fucking, cursed.
"Maldita sea mi suerte!" - "Damn my luck!"

*eat*
verb: eat, lunch, meal.
"Él come mucho." = He eats a lot.

*number*
noun: number, issue, numeral.
"Tengo el número de teléfono de mi amigo." - I have my friend's phone number.

*give*
verb: give, yield, lend.
"Daré un paseo esta tarde." - I will take a walk this afternoon.

*you need*
verb: need, require, take.
Necesitas un abrigo para el invierno.
You need a coat for the winter.

*chance*
noun: opportunity, chance, occasion.
"Aprovecha esta oportunidad para mejorar tu situación." - Take advantage of this opportunity to improve your situation.

*spot*
noun: point, spot, dot.
El punto es que estoy de acuerdo. - The point is that I agree.

*same*
adjective: same, very, one.
"Ella misma preparó la comida para la fiesta." - She herself prepared the food for the party.

*last*
noun: ultima.
La última vez que nos vimos fue hace dos años. - The last time we saw each other was two years ago.

*outside*
adverb: outside, out, on the outside
adjective: out-of-doors.
"Ella se quedó afuera mientras yo entré." - She stayed outside while I went in.

*women*
noun: women, ladies.
"Las mujeres son hermosas." - Women are beautiful.

*think*
verb: think, reflect, ponder.
Pienso que esto es importante. - I think this is important.

*were*
verb: be, come, come of.
Fueron al parque. - They went to the park.

*difficult*
adjective: difficult, hard, tough.
Es difícil decidir qué hacer. It is difficult to decide what to do.

*live*
verb: live, live on, reside.
Vivo en España. (I live in Spain.)

*passed*
noun: step, passage, pass.
"Pasé una tarde muy agradable." - I spent a very pleasant afternoon.

*bad*
adjective: bad, wrong, evil
noun: villain.
"Es muy malo que no sepas nada." - It is very bad that you don't know anything.

*you were*
verb: be, stay, stand.
Estabas caminando por el parque. - You were walking through the park.

*alive*
adjective: live, alive, living.
Vivo en una ciudad pequeña. - I live in a small town.

*make*
verb: do, make, ask.
"Haga una buena acción hoy." - "Do a good deed today."

*is left over*
verb: stay, remain, keep.
"Queda mucho por hacer" - There is still much to do.

*children*
noun: offspring.
Los hijos son el regalo más grande que uno puede recibir. - Children are the greatest gift one can receive.

*elderly*
adjective: higher, major, bigger
noun: senior, elderly, elder
abbreviation: Maj..
"El mayor de los hermanos es el más responsable." - The oldest of the siblings is the most responsible.

*party*
noun: party, holiday, feast.
"Vamos a la fiesta esta noche!" - Let's go to the party tonight!

*do*
verb: do, make, ask.
"Ellos hacen una buena comida." - They make good food.

*half*
noun: means, medium, half
adjective: half, average, middle
adverb: half.
"El medio ambiente es muy importante." - The environment is very important.

*some*
adjective: some
adverb: a few.
Algunas personas llegan tarde a la fiesta. - Some people arrive late to the party.

*Enough*
interjection: Enough!, Stop it!, Enough said!.
"Basta de discutir, no hay nada más que hablar." Translation: "Enough arguing, there's nothing else to talk about."

*weapon*
noun: weapon, arm.
"Él llevaba un arma para defenderse." - He was carrying a weapon to defend himself.

*came*
noun: wine, vino.
"Ella bebió un vaso de vino", She drank a glass of wine.

*months*
noun: monthes.
"Los últimos seis meses han sido difíciles." - The last six months have been difficult.

*room*
adjective: fourth
noun: fourth, room, quarter
: fourth.
"Estoy limpiando mi cuarto." - I am cleaning my room.

*this*
pronoun: this.
Éste es mi libro favorito. - This is my favorite book.

*school*
noun: school, college, schoolhouse.
La escuela es un lugar donde se aprende. - School is a place where one learns.

*this*
adjective: this
pronoun: this one
noun: east.
"Esté tranquilo." - Be calm.

*Dollars*
.
"Gasté cien dólares en un nuevo par de zapatos." - I spent one hundred dollars on a new pair of shoes.

*uncle*
noun: uncle, guy, chap
adjective: chappy.
Mi tío es muy amable. - My uncle is very kind.

*possible*
adjective: possible, potential, likely.
"Todo es posible si trabajamos juntos." - Everything is possible if we work together.
